ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a better understanding of the czech language and its grammar.
I learned a more advanced knowledge of the Czech language and culture.
Basic, entry level Czech
I was able to better understand Czech taking this class. Not only was my grammar very much improved but I gained valuable insight into Czech culture as well.
I furthered my knowledge of reading, writing and speaking Czechoslovakian language.
na
Over the past 3 semesters I have learned so much from KVK about the culture and language of the Czech Republic.
How to speak basic czech

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is excellent at going at a good pace and making sure everyone understands concepts before moving on.
This course could use more structure. Otherwise, Professor von Kunes is a kind and engaging teacher who cares for her students and helps them learn.
Professor von Kunes is an angel

I think that some aspects of this course are not necessarily tailored to the skill level of the general student. It doesn't matter where they should be in the scope of the material. If the majority of the students  don't know how to do something or what something means, just explain it. I feel like a lot of the possible learning that could have happened was stifled by the fact that there was constant criticism for "forgotten material."
The class was a perfect extension of Czech 1 & 2.
KvK is a gem of a professor
na
I feel the strengths are how well KVK engages with her students and creates a bond that is necessary for a language in college. I felt there were no weaknesses that stood out to me.
If the class was more structured towards the foundation of the czech language before moving into more complex things

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would reccommend this course to someone who is eager to learn a language but is intimidated by being wrong.
I would recommend this course for someone who wants to try a unique language or is looking for a challenge.
If Professor von Kunes is teaching it, yes
If someone is willing to learn another language, this is a great option. Material was outlined pretty well and there was constant repetition and practice to make sure the concepts stuck.
Yes, if you have taken the earlier classes as a foundation.
na
Yes, it was a good course to engage with. KVK does a great job creating relationships and styling her teaching for each student.
Yes great class love kvk
